title: NewsBreak: October Fed Rate Cut Priced In After Weak ISM PMI By Investing.com
text:
NewsBreak: October Fed Rate Cut Priced In After Weak ISM PMI

Economy 34 minutes ago (Oct 01, 2019 11:11AM ET)

© Reuters. Investing.com - The fed funds futures market now predicts the Federal Reserve will cut rates by a quarter point this month following weak manufacturing data out this morning. The market is pricing in a 57.7% chance of an October cut of 25 basis points, according to Investing.com’s . Yesterday the odds stood at 42.8%. The Institute of Supply Management said its dropped to 47.8 in September, the lowest index reading in 10 years, from 49.1 in August. Economists were predicting a rise to 50.4. President Donald Trump blamed the Fed for the weak numbers, tweeting that it had allowed the dollar to appreciate with rates too high and that the Fed doesn’t “have a clue”.

NewsBreak: October Fed Rate Cut Priced In After Weak ISM PMI
